headline: Walmart International CEO McLay to Depart
summary: Kathryn McLay, who has been Walmart International’s CEO since 2023, will step down but remain with the company through the end of the first quarter to help with the transition.

headline: Kathryn McLay to depart Walmart
summary: BENTONVILLE, Ark., January 15, 2026--Walmart Inc. (Nasdaq: WMT) today announced Kathryn McLay, President and CEO, Walmart International, will depart Walmart. McLay will remain in the role until January 31st but will continue at the company through the first quarter to help ensure a smooth transition.

headline: Massive Corporate Layoffs Changed Everything, Says Robert Kiyosaki. Calls Going To School For Job Security An 'Obsolete Idea'
summary: Robert Kiyosaki says the recent wave of corporate job cuts shows that the traditional promise of stability through schooling no longer holds up in today's economy. In a recent post on X, the investor and author of “Rich Dad Poor Dad” argued that going to school for job security has become an “obsolete idea,” especially as layoffs hit industries that once symbolized safety, prestige, and high pay. His comments come amid continued workforce reductions across logistics, retail, manufacturing, and t

headline: I’d Avoid iShares Consumer Staples ETF Right Now
summary: When market volatility picks up, investors typically flock to consumer staples ETFs for defensive characteristics and steady dividends. But the iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (NYSEARCA:KXI) presents a different story. Despite holding household names like Walmart (NASDAQ:WMT) and Costco (NASDAQ:COST), the fund’s high expenses, modest yield, and concentrated exposure to stocks trading near all-time highs ... I’d Avoid iShares Consumer Staples ETF Right Now
